marketNews.title: EXCL 2Q25: Net Loss Rp1.6 Trillion, Below Expectations
marketNews.content: XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera (EXCL) recorded a net loss of 1.6 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: profit of 385 billion rupiah, 2Q24: profit of 484 billion rupiah). This result makes the net loss for EXCL in the first half of 2025 amount to 1.2 trillion rupiah (vs. 1H24: profit of 1 trillion rupiah), below the 2025F consensus estimate that projected a net profit of 1.5 trillion rupiah. Key points: Number of mobile subscribers rose to 82.6 million in 2Q25 (+41% YoY, +40% QoQ), below the initial estimate of 94.5 million. Management explained that the lower subscriber base compared to the estimate was due to harmonisation of subscriber definitions after the merger. Average revenue per user (ARPU) for mobile fell to 36 thousand rupiah in 2Q25 (-14% YoY, -5% QoQ) because the ARPU of Smartfren customers was lower (2024: 24 thousand rupiah) compared to XL Axiata (2024: 43 thousand rupiah). Increase in costs across all expense categories after the merger: The quarterly net loss in 2Q25 was caused by a more aggressive rise in total expenses than revenue growth. The main expense increase came from salaries and employee costs, reaching 1.1 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+139% YoY, +114% QoQ) due to higher headcount, and infrastructure costs of 3 trillion rupiah (+39% YoY, +29% QoQ) due to more sites and regulatory costs from additional spectrum obtained after the merger. All these expenses pushed the post-tax loss to 1.6 trillion rupiah in 2Q25. Nevertheless, EXCL reported a normalized profit after tax of 313 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-36% YoY, -19% QoQ) when excluding one-off items such as integration costs (379 billion rupiah), accelerated depreciation (739 billion rupiah), and asset impairment (802 billion rupiah). The asset impairment recorded in 2Q25 relates to assets held for the 900 MHz frequency band, which will be returned by EXCL at the end of 2026. Guidance for 2025: EBITDA margin around 40-45%. Following the post-merger release, management announced an initial guidance for 2025 with revenue growth target of +20-30% YoY (vs. +12% YoY in 1H25) and an EBITDA margin of 40-45% (vs. 46% in 1H25). Management also anticipates additional integration costs of 1 trillion rupiah in 2H25 and expects a reduction in opex of about 100-200 million US dollars (equivalent to 1.6-3.2 trillion rupiah) this year. Key Takeaway: After the financial release, EXCL shares fell 6.8% to 2,760 rupiah per share on Wednesday (27/8). We assess that the market reacted negatively due to the larger-than-expected integration cost realization. Going forward, EXCL performance through the end of 2025 will remain challenging because of (1) projected additional integration costs up to 1 trillion rupiah in 2H25 and (2) continued accelerated depreciation related to 900 MHz equipment and legacy vendor assets. This is also reflected in the expected decline of EBITDA margin from 46% in 2Q25 to a range of 40-45% for 2025, partly due to the lower EBITDA margin of FREN.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto told Reuters on Tuesday (26/8) that the United States has essentially agreed to grant near-zero tariffs for Indonesian cocoa, palm oil, and rubber, which were previously subject to a 19% tariff imposed by former President Donald Trump. Hartarto claimed the tariff exemption will take effect after both parties reach a final agreement, but no schedule has been set because the U.S. is busy negotiating tariffs with other countries. The U.S. Embassy in Jakarta has not responded to Hartarto's claim.
2. Thousands of workers from various regions will hold a demonstration on Thursday (28/8) at the DPR RI building and the Presidential Palace, Jakarta. Said Iqbal, President of the Labour Party and President of the Confederation of Indonesian Workers' Unions, said the workers are demanding wage increases and the elimination of outsourcing through the protest.
3. Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, Chairman of the Board of Commissioners of the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS), said LPS is lowering the maximum guaranteed deposit interest rate for conventional banks by 25 basis points to 3.75%. The maximum guarantee rate for foreign-currency deposits in conventional banks remains at 2.25%. These rates will apply from 28 August to 30 September 2025. The decision follows a trend of interest-rate reductions and aims to strengthen economic performance while reaffirming policy synergy.
4. Bloomberg reported that Danantara has signed a master agreement worth USD 1.42 billion with GEM Co. Ltd. to develop an HPAL smelter with a production capacity of 66,000 tonnes of nickel MHP per year. The two parties will co-invest in the project, which is expected to involve collaboration with Vale Indonesia (INCO) and other partners.
5. British oil company EnQuest announced that it, together with its joint-venture partners and the Indonesian government, has signed a production sharing contract for the Gaea and Gaea II exploration blocks in West Papua. EnQuest holds a 40% participation right in both blocks. The agreement marks EnQuest's entry into Indonesia.
6. Archi Indonesia (ARCI) through its subsidiary PT Tambang Tondano Nusajaya appointed PT Macmahon Indonesia as the mining services contractor for the underground Kopra mine project. The cooperation will last 34 months, with the transaction value not disclosed.

tickerNews.title: MDKA: Project Gold Pani subsidiary plans IPO
tickerNews.content: MDKA: Kontan reported that the subsidiary of Merdeka Copper Gold managing the Pani gold project has registered for an IPO with the OJK. The IPO is expected to be held in September 2025, with Trimegah Sekuritas Indonesia (TRIM) and Indo Premier Sekuritas acting as underwriters. Indo Premier told Kontan that it has no information to disclose, while TRIM has not responded.

tickerNews.title: BREN: Shareholder sells 2 billion shares
tickerNews.content: BREN: The shareholder of Barito Renewables Energy, Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd., sold 2 billion BREN shares, according to KSEI data as of 22 August 2025. The transaction value is unknown. After the sale, Green Era Energy's ownership in BREN fell from 23.6% to 22.1%. Previously, Green Era sold 8.3 million BREN shares at an average price of 9,126 rupiah per share on 11-13 August 2025 to increase the free float of the stock.

tickerNews.title: PGAS: Gas sales volume for 7M25
tickerNews.content: PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara recorded gas sales volume of 834 billion standard cubic meters (BBtud) during the first seven months of 2025 (7M25), down 2% YoY, roughly 4-13% below the 2025 target range of 873-958 BBtud. Meanwhile, gas transmission volume reached 1,638 million standard cubic feet per day (MMSCFD) in 7M25 (+10% YoY), exceeding the 2025 target of 1,435 MMSCFD by 14%. Upstream gas sales volume was 16,519 barrels of oil equivalent per day (BOEPD) in 7M25 (-20% YoY), 4% below the 2025 target of 17,227 BOEPD.

tickerNews.title: MITI: Obtains exploration mining permits for silica sand
tickerNews.content: MITI: Mitra Investindo, through its business entities PT Danau Buntar Kuarsa and PT Kendawangan Prima Silika, obtained exploration mining permits (IUP) for silica sand. The IUP for PT Danau Buntar Kuarsa covers a work area of 4,888 hectares, while the IUP for PT Kendawangan Prima Silika covers 2,965 hectares. Both permit areas are located in Ketapang Regency, West Kalimantan, adjacent to the permit area of MITI's other entity, PT Kendawangan Berkah Kersik, which received an exploration permit at the end of January 2025.

tickerNews.title: DSSA: Joint venture with FirstGen Geothermal Indonesia
tickerNews.content: DSSA: Dian Swastatika Sentosa, through its subsidiary PT DSSR Daya Mas Sakti, formed a joint venture with PT FirstGen Geothermal Indonesia, a subsidiary of Energy Development Corporation, which is part of First Gen Corporation. The partnership will focus on developing and operating geothermal resources with a combined potential capacity of about 440 MW across six fields located in West Java, Flores, Jambi, West Sumatra, and Central Sulawesi. Energy Development Corporation is a renewable energy producer from the Philippines.

tickerNews.title: KRYA: New director appointed and share purchase
tickerNews.content: KRYA: On Tuesday, 26 August 2025, shareholders of Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya approved the appointment of William Teng as the new President Director, replacing Dharmo Budiono. William Teng currently serves as CEO of PT Green City Traffic (ECGO) and director of Green City SG Pte. Ltd. Meanwhile, Green City SG Pte. Ltd. purchased 41% of KRYA shares at a price of 33 rupiah per share on 25 August 2025. This transaction is part of a new controlling shareholder acquisition that the company announced in July 2025.

tickerNews.title: ARCI: Archi Indonesia appoints contractor for underground mine
tickerNews.content: ARCI: Archi Indonesia, through its subsidiary PT Tambang Tondano Nusajaya, appointed PT Macmahon Indonesia as the mining services contractor for the underground Kopra mine project. The cooperation will last for 34 months, with the transaction value not disclosed.
